result.execSummary:
All charges against AUSTIN J. SCHROEDER in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. AUSTIN J. SCHROEDER is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. AUSTIN J. SCHROEDER

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant AUSTIN J. SCHROEDER appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Nicole A Morley in court for AUSTIN J. SCHROEDER. Working on a resolution, adjourn plea and sentencing and remove jury trial.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession or consumption of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  COMPLY WITH CONDITIONS OF THE ALCOHOL 24/7 PROGRAM. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing. THE DEFENDANT SHALL BRING THE ALCOHOL MONITORING DEVICE TO EVERY HEARING.

2:44 PM Defendant AUSTIN J. SCHROEDER in court with attorney Nicole A Morley.  Defendant AUSTIN J. SCHROEDER in custody.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AUSTIN J. SCHROEDER appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with.  Def. moves to modify bond.  State objects.  Court amends cash bond to a Signature Bond.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
